newsitem.title: JORDAN: EU envoy hopeful of Hebron accord this week.
newsitem.headline: EU envoy hopeful of Hebron accord this week.

text.p: The European Union's new Middle East envoy said on Monday he was optimistic that a long-delayed Israeli troop redeployment from the West Bank town of Hebron would take place this week.

"We hope this week will give us good news..and this good news is that finally the Hebron issue is finalised and the Israeli army redeployed from Hebron," Miquel Angel Moratinos told reporters in Amman after meeting Prime Minister Abdul Karim al-Kabariti.

Moratinos, who was appointed by the EU last October to exert a more forceful European role to salvage Arab-Israeli peace negotiations, is on a regional tour that has already taken him to Israel, Palestinian self-rule areas and Syria.
Two months of PLO-Israeli talks on implementing the Hebron handover have not resolved some key elements of the deal.
Palestinian officials said on Sunday that U.S. and Egyptian efforts to clinch a deal have been stepped up, with those countries aiding the sides in drafting documents they hope might narrow gaps.
